metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8501 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The _bfd_XXi_swap_aouthdr_in function in bfd/peXXigen.c in GNU binutils2.24 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds write) and possibly have other unspecified impact via acrafted NumberOfRvaAndSizes field in the AOUT header in a PE executable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8501` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdb - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-minimal - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-multiarch - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-source - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb64 - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdbserver - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
No subscription required

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gdb package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3').
binutils package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu3.1').
